trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse system views | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse system views | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Links to system views content for SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Links to system views content for SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse dynamic management views (DMVs)
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse dynamic management views (DMVs)

trans-unit.source: List of SQL Server DMVs available in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: List of SQL Server DMVs available in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse exposes many of the SQL Server dynamic management views (DMVs).
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse exposes many of the SQL Server dynamic management views (DMVs).

trans-unit.source: These views, when queried in SQL Data Warehouse, are reporting the state of SQL Database running on the distributions.
trans-unit.target: These views, when queried in SQL Data Warehouse, are reporting the state of SQL Database running on the distributions.

trans-unit.source: Since SQL Data Warehouse is built on Microsoft's MPP technology, both SQL Data Warehouse and Analytics Platform System's Parallel Data Warehouse (PDW) use the same system views.
trans-unit.target: Since SQL Data Warehouse is built on Microsoft's MPP technology, both SQL Data Warehouse and Analytics Platform System's Parallel Data Warehouse (PDW) use the same system views.

trans-unit.source: This is why each of these DMV's has a specific column called pdw_node_id.
trans-unit.target: This is why each of these DMV's has a specific column called pdw_node_id.

trans-unit.source: This is the the identifier for the Compute node.
trans-unit.target: This is the the identifier for the Compute node.

trans-unit.source: In PDW the Compute node is a stronger concept for the architecture.
trans-unit.target: In PDW the Compute node is a stronger concept for the architecture.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Data Warehouse, the architecture relies more heavily on the distributions.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Data Warehouse, the architecture relies more heavily on the distributions.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To use these view, insert ‘pdw_nodes_’ into the name, as shown in the following table.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To use these view, insert ‘pdw_nodes_’ into the name, as shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: DMV name in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: DMV name in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.target: Link to SQL Server Transact-SQL topic on MSDN

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2016 PolyBase dmvs available in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2016 PolyBase dmvs available in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: SQL Database DMVs available in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: SQL Database DMVs available in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: These are links to the SQL Server Information Schema views available in SQL Server PDW.
trans-unit.target: These are links to the SQL Server Information Schema views available in SQL Server PDW.

trans-unit.source: All of the INFORMATION_SCHEMA views that you would expect to see in SQL Server are available in SQL Server PDW.
trans-unit.target: All of the INFORMATION_SCHEMA views that you would expect to see in SQL Server are available in SQL Server PDW.

trans-unit.source: For more reference information, see [SQL Data Warehouse reference overview][].
trans-unit.target: For more reference information, see [SQL Data Warehouse reference overview][].
